summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary telephonic interview conducted on June 16, 2021, with a former Federal Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant from the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York. The interview was part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; a BOP inmate (Register Number 76318-054) who died while housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York.

events.title: OIG Interview of former BOP Lieutenant
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary telephonic interview of a former BOP Lieutenant from MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Boston Area Office (DOJ OIG reporting office)
keyFacts: The document is part of an official OIG investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

The interviewee was a former Operations Lieutenant at MCC New York when Epstein was housed there and was, at the time of the interview, employed by U.S. Department of Homeland Security, Customs and Border Protection.
The interview was recorded and transcribed; the audio file and transcript are attached to the memorandum.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is not to be distributed outside the receiving agency.
